GPT_response.title: Presidents and Thanksgiving
GPT_response.background: This article discusses the history of Thanksgiving in the United States and the role that three Presidents - George Washington, Abraham Lincoln, and Franklin Roosevelt - played in making the holiday a national event. These Presidents faced financial challenges during their time in office, and they all used government-issued money and credit to navigate through these crises. The article also touches on the current state of the U.S. economy, including the national debt and infrastructure funding.
GPT_response.summary: Three U.S. presidents - George Washington, Abraham Lincoln, and Franklin Roosevelt - established Thanksgiving as a regular national event. All three Presidents faced financial challenges during their time in office and used government-issued money and credit to overcome these challenges. The article also mentions the current state of the U.S. economy, including the national debt and the need for infrastructure funding.
